intro: Melilotus tenellus, commonly known as lesser melilot, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
